item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "That's the worst of girls," said Edmund to Peter and the Dwarf. "They never can carry a map in their heads." "That's because our heads have something inside them," said Lucy." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis; Inspirational Christian Library
item.description: "We meet no ordinary people in our lives." -- C.S. Lewis; Inspirational Christian Library

item.title: Emily add a quote by Andrew Davidson
item.description: "These day's I like to imagine that if a man were to enter through the slash on the book's cover, as if it were a door, he could walk right into the heart of the Inferno." -- Andrew Davidson

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It isn't Narnia, you know," sobbed Lucy. "It's you. We shan't meet you there. And how can we live, never meeting you?" "But you shall meet me, dear one," said Aslan. "Are -are you there too, Sir?" said Edmund. "I am," said Aslan. "But there I have another name. You must learn to know me by that name. This was the very reason why you were brought to Narnia, that by knowing me here for a little, you may know me better there." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I know now, Lord, why you utter no answer. You are yourself the answer. Before your face questions die away. What other answer would suffice?" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "It was better not to judge the man who had gone down under an impossible burden. It was better to remember: Thou knowest this man's fall, but thou knowest not his wrassling." -- James Baldwin
